creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
Collector stamp  in brown ink, verso center right: A.F. von Lanna (Lugt 2773)

Collector stamp in black ink, verso lower left: Julian Marshall (Lugt 1494)
inscribed:
Inscribed and dated in plate, upper: MORIBUS ANTIQVIS AETAT. 40. Ao. 1587 

Signed in plate, lower right: HG. Fe.

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Julian Marshall [1836-1903, Lugt 1496]; sale of his collection, London, June 30, 1864, lot 799; Adalbert von Lanna [1836-1909, Lugt 2773]; sale of his collection, Stuttgart, May 11-22, 1909, lot 1826; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
